TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IComSoapIISVRoot

Docs.summary: Interface definition for creating and deleting Internet Information Services (IIS) 6.0 virtual roots.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> interface defines methods for creating and deleting virtual roots in IIS 6.0.
This interface is implemented only by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IISVirtualRoot> class and is used only within the .NET Framework infrastructure while creating a SOAP-enabled COM+ application virtual root.
<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> does not need to be implemented directly in your code. Instead, use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class, which implements the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface that contains the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.CreateVirtualRoot%2A> and <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> methods. However, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> is not fully implemented by <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish>.
<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> is used internally by the .NET Framework. You do not need to use it directly in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Create (string RootWeb, string PhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, out string Error);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Create(string RootWeb, string PhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, string Error) cil managed

Docs.param: The physical path of the virtual root, which corresponds to PhysicalPath from the method.
The name of the virtual root, which corresponds to VirtualRoot from the method.
A string to which an error message can be written.
Docs.summary: Creates an Internet Information Services (IIS) virtual root.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> interface does not need to be implemented directly in your code. Instead, use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface (implemented by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class), which exposes a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.CreateVirtualRoot%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Delete (string RootWeb, string PhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, out string Error);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete(string RootWeb, string PhysicalDirectory, string VirtualDirectory, string Error) cil managed

Docs.param: The physical path of the virtual root.
The name of the virtual root.
A string to which an error message can be written.
Docs.summary: Deletes an Internet Information Services (IIS) virtual root.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> interface does not need to be implemented directly in your code. Alternatively, the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface (implemented by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class), exposes a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> method. However, that method is not fully implemented by <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish>.
